item.description:
Hopefully we will have some good weather for this walk and can get a swim in, too!
Plum Island is an island next to Newburyport on the North Shore. The island includes a town on one half, and a nature reservation on the other called the Parker River National Wildlife Refuge. We will meet at 10:00 am in the first parking lot inside the pay-gate to the refuge (its $5 to enter reservation per car). Pay to enter, then go to the first parking lot to meet everyone. We will then drive several miles down a dirt road, and park at parking lot 6. The walk will begin there. We will walk along the beach around the tip of the island (going south), and then return. I did this last year, and it was a beautiful beach walk-the tip of the island is really cool with pools of water and rocks and a view of Crane's beach.

Afterwords, we will then have dinner at the Grog in Newburport, which is a fun restaurant/bar with seafood and other food. Carpooling strongly encouraged.

I suggest bringing bug repellant (for flies, mosquitos in the evening). Bring a bathing suit etc. if you want to swim after the walk.

After the group walk, if we have time, and people want to wander around on their own for a bit, that's fine.

Here's a link with some details on Plum Island and the reservation: http://www.plum-islan....

Here's a link to a map of the reservation. http://www.fws.gov/no...

Directions from Boston to the refuge gatehouse: Distances approximate: the refuge is located 35 miles (56.3 kilometers) north of Boston near the City of Newburyport. From Route 95 take exit 57 and travel east on Route 113, then continue straight onto Route 1A South to the intersection with Rolfe?s Lane for a total of 3.5 miles (5.6 kilometers). Turn left onto Rolfe?s Lane and travel 0.5 miles (0.8 kilometers) to its end. Turn right onto the Plum Island Turnpike and travel 2.0 miles (3.2 kilometers) crossing the Sgt. Donald Wilkinson Bridge to Plum Island. Take your first right onto Sunset Drive and travel 0.5 miles (0.8 kilometers) to the refuge entrance.
